description: Works well but is very unorganized and brings back flashbacks of windows registry.

dconf Editor in it self as a front end is ok, back end wise however is kind of messy and not functional at times for an example changing the default save directory for screenshots in dconf Editor/configuration database doesn't translate to any change in GNOME Screenshot/PrtScr default save directory.
The app is like Arch; unusably simplistic. Like Windows registry.

Having a front-end for managing dconf settings is very helpful, but Dconf Editor used to have a much better interface than it does now. Schemas were shown in a nested tree format in a sidebar on the left, keys were shown in a main view, and below that was a section for the description of the key & its values. Now there's only a single view that shows only one of those things at a time, which can make it hard to navigate & mentally manage everything.

The worst part is that it's only possible to search FORWARDS, not backwards! This makes navigating through search results is a pain. Also, all searches are performed ahead of the current location, and it doesn't roll back to the beginning when reaching the end. So to search the entire database, it's necessary to go to the root folder first and *then* search.

Also, the flatpak version handles a different (and much smaller) set of schemas than the non-flatpak version, but that is probably intentional.
summary: Good, but the UI redesign is bad

description:
Dconf Editor got yet facelift recently, and it's actually quite impressive! The star of the show is the revamped search functionality: now, search results are shown all at once in the main window as you're typing, instead of having to walk through search results one at a time (and only in one direction). Search results are also neatly organized, separating folders & keys that match your search terms, and placing results that are in your favourites at the top of the list. Being able to just start typing a search and getting results right away feels quite modern and fits very well into Gnome 3's look & feel, which uses the "just start typing" flow in other programs as well.

The visuals of Dconf Editor has been reworked as well: rows are a bit thicker to make room for key descriptions on listing pages; key editing pages give more room for editing string keys; and keys changed from their default values are more clearly marked as having been edited. There are other minor changes here and there, too.

Overall, I'm a fan of the direction Dconf Editor is taking, and dare I say it, I don't even miss the sidebar anymore! The search, display, navigation are just that good now.
Good ui & functionality
This gives you a lot of facilities to set your things up.
Amazing and super useful app. Provides a lot more control over several settings.

Along the way it helps someone like me get to know a tiny bit more about how this magnificent OS works behind the scenes. Seems relatively safe even for a total newbie to explore. Highly recommend.

description:
I like having seconds displayed in the Panel Clock, and this is the "human" way to do it. - Took me all of 5 minutes, including learning the GUI interface. It has a built in search option, so once you know what to look for it's instantaneous. Ask for the "magic word" on any of the countless helpful forums and websites, tell them you have Dconf, and the World of Wizardry opens. A tiny bit. 

I also enjoy tinkering and learning a little about how things work. The GUI interface makes it pretty easy to see how things work, AND to change it back if things get scary.
summary: Amazing for Tweaks, Great for just Looking under the hood

Con Ubuntu 18.04 Gnome3 no es posible minimizar las aplicaciones mediante el clic sobre el icono de la app en el dock. Tampoco existe la posibilidad de configurarlo en ninguna pantalla, como si se podía en Unity.
Con esta utilidad sí se puede cambiar el comportamiento por defecto y conseguir minimizar las aplicaciones desde el dock. ¡Un éxito!
summary: Muy útil. Me ha funcionado perfectamente

description:
Para poder minimizar las ventanas haciendo click sobre los íconos del Dock, simplemente hay que navegar en la siguiente ruta:

/org/gnome/shell/extensions/dash-to-dock/click-action

y como "Valor predeterminado" escoger: "minimize"
summary: Minimizar ventanas con "click" en el Dock

description: es excelente, sería bueno que tenga una modalidad de navegación en forma de árbol

/org/gnome/desktop/interface/enable-animations

Desactivar Animaciones

Añadir por defecto la columna 'tipo' en Nautilus:
/org/gnome/nautius/list-view/default-visible-columns

Долго искал подобный инструмент чтобы можно было добавлять и редактировать "локали", т.к в ОС присутствует только UTF-8 и многие тексты(шрифты) например под Windows не корректно отображаются. С помощью этого приложения решить и поправить это очень легко. Вот только очень жаль что интерфейс программы не поддерживает русский язык. Рекомендую..
очень осторожно

/org/gnome/desktop/peripherals/touchpad/ -> send-events -> выпадающий список Custom value и выберите опцию "disabled-on-external-mouse".
Сохраните настройки и закройте редактор dconf. Теперь ваш тачпад будет автоматически отключаться каждый раз, когда вы подключаете USB-устройство мыши.
summary: Автоматическое отключение touchpad, при подключении мыши
